title: Spanish Business Communication and Scientific Inquiry Skills Enhancement Course Based on Science-Specific Terminology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic grammar and daily conversational proficiency (CEFR A1–B1 level), and foundational understanding of scientific concepts (hypothesis formulation, experimental design, data measurement/analysis methods)
context.additional_context: Enhancing specialized terminology acquisition and workplace application skills for science professionals. Focuses on cultivating abilities to write and interpret scientific texts (lab reports, academic abstracts, research proposals). Specialized in improving Spanish expression skills for the scientific inquiry process (observation → hypothesis → experiment → analysis → conclusion).

learning_goals: Improve proficiency in writing Spanish emails and experimental reports using 500 core science terminology items (hypothesis, experiment, variable, analysis, evidence, observation, measurement, conclusion, etc.).

Achieve intermediate+ Spanish reading/listening proficiency (CEFR B1-B2) through blog-based learning objects and cultivate analytical skills for scientific texts (experimental procedures, data analysis, research interpretation).

Over six months, learners can perform weekly blog activities (posting ≥3 scientific observation/hypothesis-related comments on peer posts, writing ≥1 scientific topic post weekly), revise posts reflecting ≥4 out of 5 peer feedbacks (80%), and participate in ≥24 scientific discussions (debates, questions, counterarguments, variable control discussions, etc.) at least once weekly.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
